last_episode_to_air.name: Jillian & Emerson - Lakeside Landing
last_episode_to_air.overview: When Jillian and Emerson's stepdad passed, the cottage he was helping them build came to a halt; Scott and Debra step up to the challenge and build a two-storey cottage with windows to the lake, vaulted ceilings and contemporary design.

name: Scott's Vacation House Rules
overview: Does owning a dream vacation property seem out of reach? Real estate expert and contractor Scott McGillivray offers the ultimate road map to renovation and rental success in Scott’s Vacation House Rules. With years of smart real estate investing and renovation experience, Scott will unlock the rental potential of even the most uninspired properties. Finding and transforming tired, dated and rundown spaces into unique and buzz-worthy parcels of paradise, Scott’s Vacation House Rules will prove that any dream property is always within reach. Scott’s Vacation House Rules is produced by McGillivray Entertainment in association with Corus Studios for HGTV Canada.

episodes.name: Bavarian Guest House - Bernd and Crystal
episodes.overview: Bavarian Guest House - Bernd and Crystal

episodes.name: Malibu Beach House - Katherine and Jason
episodes.overview: Scott transforms a rundown family cottage into a Malibu-inspired, 5-star beach retreat.

episodes.name: Pet Friendly Paradise - Mark and Lynn
Zen Holiday Hideaway - Code and Karen
Carriage House - Laura and Dale
episodes.overview: Scott transforms a historic carriage house into a chic vacation rental.

episodes.name: Muskoka Makeover / Alison and Kelsey
episodes.overview: Scott transforms a modest cottage into an executive style Muskoka retreat.

episodes.name: Retro Retreat / John and Dawn
episodes.overview: Scott turns a Wasaga Beach party pad into a trendy, mid-century inspired vacation destination.

episodes.name: Holltop Ski Chalet / Meghan and Ryan
episodes.overview: Scott transforms a hilltop cabin into a luxurious ski chalet worthy of Whistler or Aspen

episodes.name: Four Season Rental; Cassandra and Kelsey
episodes.overview: Scott transforms a rundown lakeside cottage into a stylish vacation rental that attracts paying guests year round.

episodes.name: Falling Water
episodes.overview: Mother and son team Elli and Clark desperately need Scott’s help transforming their neglected cabin into a successful vacation rental. With a tranquil waterfall just steps from the front door, Scott plunges into a design plan that immerses renters in the experience of the nearby waterfall. Very quickly, Scott uncovers some big surprises and more water than he bargained for.

episodes.name: Game Time Getaway
episodes.overview: Homeowners Jackie and Teresa purchase an aging two-bedroom property and need Scott's help transforming the haphazard, gloomy layout into a bright and spacious vacation rental that will help build their nest egg.

episodes.name: Artistic Retreat
episodes.overview: Scott harnesses his creativity and transforms a former art studio at the back of Sarah and Nick's property into an artistic retreat that doubles as a gallery where paying guests can view and buy the work of local artists.

episodes.name: Parent's Paradise
episodes.overview: Aleisha and Justin's rundown vacation property can't be rented in the state it's in; a week by the lake is the most popular vacation for young families so Scott adds fun, family-friendly amenities that will keep this property booked year after year.

episodes.name: Back to the Future
episodes.overview: Christine and Sam's newly purchased vacation property looks like a time capsule from the 1970's; Scott harnesses the swinging 70's look of the home, but adds 21st Century tech to create a groovy, functional tech getaway.

episodes.name: Hawk's Nest
episodes.overview: With property taxes and maintenance fees going through the roof, Tara-Lee and Bryan need their rarely-used vacation rental to start paying for itself.

episodes.name: Country Charmer
episodes.overview: Sisters Erin and Megan are falling in love with the charm of Prince Edward County and setting about renovating a century old farmhouse.

episodes.name: Executive Lodge
episodes.overview: A million dollar party lodge where privacy and walls weren't a priority; Chris and David need Scott's help turning it into a successful vacation rental; Scott sets out transforming the property into an executive-style lodge.

episodes.name: Winter Wonderland
episodes.overview: Transforming the property into a paradise for anyone ready to hit the snowmobile trails, ice fish or just curl up in front of the fireplace with a good book to make the property lucrative during winter.

episodes.name: Canoe Club
episodes.overview: Inside and out, Nadia's cabin in the woods looks more like the type of dull, dated suburban home renters are trying to escape for a week; Scott injects the property with a fun canoe theme design.

episodes.name: Bienvenido A Casa
episodes.overview: After a recent fire and years of neglect, sisters Jessica, Sabrina and Sue need Scott's help turning a giant problem into profit; inspired by the family's South American heritage, Scott sets out to create a Spanish Revival.

episodes.name: Country Club
episodes.overview: Elena and Kelly's property resembles a giant beige box with almost nothing that attracts renters; Scott aims to change that with an ambitious Country Club inspired theme.

episodes.name: Beach Bungalow
episodes.overview: With rolling sand dunes, powdery sand and epic sunsets just outside the door, Eva and Stewart should have no problem renting their beachside property, but no one has renovated the place since the 1970's.

episodes.name: Scandi Ski Chalet; Vicky and Todd
episodes.overview: Vicky and Todd recently bought a dated old house near a ski hill, and they think it could earn them some money - if the proper reno job were done.

episodes.name: Historic Highland Lodge; Cindy and Sean
episodes.overview: Fitness instructors Cindy and Sean own a historic 150-year-old cabin in Muskoka; they're hoping to rent it out to fund their travel plans, but first they want the years of add-ons remodeled; Scott McGillivray and his team take on this project.

episodes.name: Boho Boathouse; Sabrina and Tess
episodes.overview: Sabrina and her daughter Tess purchase a large but neglected boathouse on the scenic Lake of Bays.

episodes.name: Lakeview Farmhouse; Megan and Marc
episodes.overview: Marc, a fire captain in the city, buys a farmhouse to create some family memories with his son, and daughter Megan; however, it's pretty clear this rundown place was built purely for function.

episodes.name: Throwback Getaway; Erin and Gerald
episodes.overview: Erin and Gerald are the owners of a rundown cottage they don't use so much anymore. They're hoping that a good renovation will turn it into a profit generator. Scott sees the potential here to pay homage to the 1980s while bringing it into the 21st century, creating a retro rockin' throwback getaway!

episodes.name: Homestead Hideaway; Reesha and Duncan
episodes.overview: Homeowners Reesha and Duncan purchased a rundown lakeside cabin to rent out and generate income for their growing family.

episodes.name: Classic Cabin; Julia and John
episodes.overview: After going more than half a century without renovations, Julia and John are hoping their worn out family cabin, which was built by John's grandfather, can start generating money for them.

episodes.name: Playful Paradise; Rowan and Curtis
episodes.overview: Rowan and his son, Curtis, bought a 3 bedroom lake house to enjoy and rent out for part of the year. But the property is looking bland and boring. Scott decides to turn this place into a playful paradise to match the energetic personas of the buyers.

episodes.name: Northern Getaway; Darlene and James
episodes.overview: Empty nesters Darlene and James have a family cottage located on the Moon River that's in bad need of repair.

episodes.name: European Villa; Anita and Marco
episodes.overview: Anita's dad's Muskoka cottage has strong bones but is very outdated, so she wants to turn it into a place that will both honor his legacy and generate an income so the family can hold onto the property.

episodes.name: Zen'd Out Retreat; Caroline and Gihad
episodes.overview: For front line healthcare workers Caroline and Gihad, the decision to buy a cottage was influenced by their stressful jobs.

episodes.name: Funky Farmhouse; Nadia and Anwar
episodes.overview: Nadia and Anwar bought their farmhouse as a generational property to enjoy with their daughters, but also with the intention of generating some short-term rental income.

episodes.name: Cliffside Cabin; Blake
episodes.overview: Scott and his best friend Blake always hoped they'd have cottages on the same lake, so after Blake purchases a rundown property down the road, Scott decides to help his buddy out by renovating it, but the job is as steep as the cliff it sits on.

episodes.name: Breezy Beach House; Amanda and Emily
episodes.overview: Sisters-in-law Amanda and Emily took a leap of faith and invested in a cottage together; Scott and Debra bring their skills to transform this dark paneled property into a light, breezy beach house - keeping peace in the family, and on the lake.

episodes.name: Limitless Lakeside Retreat; Emma and Clayton
episodes.overview: Emma and her husband Clayton want to future proof their family cottage against Emma's increasing physical challenges; Scott creates a fabulous lakeside rental with an accessible chef's kitchen, a universal bathroom, and a spacious primary suite.

episodes.name: Coastal Cabin; Kelly and Paul
episodes.overview: Kelly must convince her husband Paul that purchasing an old dark cottage will help their retirement; Scott leans into the gorgeous teal lake this property sits on and gets to work with Deb transforming it into a beautiful coastal cabin.

episodes.name: Bayside Bungalow; Melissa and Adam
episodes.overview: Millennials Melissa and Adam buy a dated lakeside property with kitschy contents included; Scott looks past the kitsch and sees the future by renovating it with the latest home technology, including integrated security, magnetic tiles, and more.

episodes.name: Sunset Grove; Natalie and Kevin
episodes.overview: Natalie and Kevin are busy parents with full-time careers; when they're up at their cottage, the last thing they want to do is have to work on repairing it; Scott to the rescue.

episodes.name: Family Lake House; Jeff and Katie
episodes.overview: When siblings Steph, Jeff, and Katie unexpectedly inherit their family cottage, they are desperate to keep it, but can't rent it out in its current condition.

episodes.name: Mid-Century Getaway; Andy and Jeff
episodes.overview: Andy and Jeff sold their place in the city planning to retire to this happening town, but they will need to rent out this bungalow for a few years yet. Scott and Debra enter into the mid-century spirit of the place to create a cool vacation spot complete with top-of-the-line fixtures, paired with original elements, and a unique mid-century vibe.

episodes.name: Beachside Abode; Sarah and Rob
episodes.overview: Sarah and Rob want to create the dream beach cottage out of this run-down property to take advantage of the newfound popularity of the area. But the cottage they purchased is a bit of a flop. When they find they have underestimated the work needed for the renovation it is Scott and his team to the rescue. This cottage will go from beach shack to beach palace with bright bold colours, and a few laughs along the way.

episodes.name: Paradise Point; Connie and Todd
episodes.overview: Newly retired Connie and Todd love their cottage but realize it is a little unfinished to earn much on the vacation rental market. Scott and his team swoop in to remove, restore and renovate this little piece of paradise so that this property can earn them some serious rental income.

episodes.name: Organic Oasis; Mark and Michael
episodes.overview: Mark and Michael's parents saw the potential in this massive bungalow for their retirement and tasked their sons to maintain it in the meantime. But the amount of work that needs to get done in order to make it marketable to renters is too much for Mark and Michael. Scott and Debra get to work and create a gorgeous open concept space with a new kitchen, spa-like bathrooms, a revived swimming pool, and a fabulous greenhouse at the center.

episodes.name: Inn on the Market; Kat and Kevin
episodes.overview: Entrepreneurs Kat and Kevin bought a huge property with the dream of running a restaurant with a vacation property above. But with limited knowledge on the vacation market, they look to Scott for help.

episodes.name: Classy Country Cottage; Jaqueline and Susan
episodes.overview: Once upon a time, Susan's happy place was her cottage. But over the years, she has become burdened by all the fixes this waterfront property needs. She and her daughter Jaqueline love the idea of renovating to rent, but where to start? When Scott and Deb tackle the to-do list, it turns from a two bedroom, one bath to a luxurious four bedroom two bath, with a decided French flair.

episodes.name: Heritage Hideaway; Ashlynn and Ryan
episodes.overview: Ryan, and his wife Ashlynn, inherited his grandmother's cottage, which has been in the family for a hundred years. But the history of this property is starting to show. There's no room for family events, let alone renters. Scott and Debra are out to change all that. They're expanding the footprint with a huge glass addition, finishing the basement, and making room for many more generations of enjoyment.

episodes.name: Sue & Daughters - Coastal Cottage
episodes.overview: Sue wants to set up her grown daughters for success by planning for her family's future. With the help of Scott and his team, Sue's aging family cottage will get a more open layout, a unified design and some new waterfront features to thrill both family and guests for many more generations.

episodes.name: Sarah & Shane - The Little Pink Cottage
episodes.overview: Sarah is a mom, entrepreneur, and social media star that needs Scott's help to renovate her and her husband Shane's run-down cottage. The goal is to attract other content creators for both work and play. Scott and Debra transform this waterfront gem into a cotton candy contemporary cottage that will be memorable online and in person.

episodes.name: Caleb & Jordan - Grey Stone Ranch
episodes.overview: Brothers Caleb and Jordan want to run a string of short-term rentals before they turn 30; Scott is happy to mentor these ambitious young men and teaches them how to convert an old farmhouse on a bison ranch into a rip-roaring, ready-to-rent.

episodes.name: Lizzie & Rushad - Country Cabin
episodes.overview: Lizzie and Rushad are well acquainted with Scott's help; he came to their aid more than ten years ago; now, after a span of fourteen years, they are once again turning to his expertise to overcome challenges with their vacation property.

episodes.name: Regina & David - Sandy Pines
episodes.overview: Regina and Dave have a two-storey cottage with too many small rooms; with three kids and demanding jobs, they need Scott and Deb to create an open concept cottage that would be great for gatherings, with tons of shore appeal and play spaces.

episodes.name: Becky & Rowan - Riverside Retreat
episodes.overview: Becky is a single mom trying to manage and maintain their vacation home that is beloved by her growing sons. But it's dated, and she can't keep up with all the fixes it needs. Scott and Debra to the rescue! They tackle some serious issues and convert this suburban-looking property into a Riverside Retreat, equipped with a cabana, fishing amenities, and a fire pit.

episodes.name: Jillian & Emerson - Lakeside Landing
episodes.overview: When Jillian and Emerson's stepdad passed, the cottage he was helping them build came to a halt; Scott and Debra step up to the challenge and build a two-storey cottage with windows to the lake, vaulted ceilings and contemporary design.
